post_text:
Good Afternoon ~
Please take a moment to read this letter from the IDCS Foundation, who are raising money for IDCS families that will be affected financially during this time either due to the need to stay home to take care of children that are out of school and/or due to the loss of hours at work.
To date, approximately 16 families have expressed a need with a total anticipated monthly deficit at $20,000 for these families.
Please consider donating here https://www.paypal.com/paypalme2/idcsfoundation?fbclid=IwAR12AgTOVJcVptx4TnW4xkaucUYQYYGnMz3NdTDNH6a0TpWFJxOtz_K31v4 to help!

To date, approximately 16 families have expressed a need with a total anticipated monthly deficit at $20,000 for these families.
Please consider donating here https://www.paypal.com/paypalme2/idcsfoundation?fbclid=IwAR12AgTOVJcVptx4TnW4xkaucUYQYYGnMz3NdTDNH6a0TpWFJxOtz_K31v4 to help!

post_text:
Good afternoon parents,
We just received the following updates from the Connecticut State Department of Education:
Connecticut schools/IDCS will be closed until April 20. IDCS will be taking Spring Break from April 13 to April 17. Neither teachers nor students will be working this week or on Good Friday, April 10, which is a statewide holiday.
The statewide SBAC tests have been waived; consequently, IDCS students will not be taking this test.
I realize this is a very difficult and challenging time for everyone. The IDCS staff are working diligently to ensure that they are preparing and delivering student work as effectively and successfully as possible. Please contact your child's teacher if you have any questions about the school work. Please contact me if you have any general questions or concerns. We miss and love our students and our IDCS community!! Be well and be safe.
Sincerely,
Ellen Retelle
text:
Good afternoon parents,
We just received the following updates from the Connecticut State Department of Education:
Connecticut schools/IDCS will be closed until April 20. IDCS will be taking Spring Break from April 13 to April 17. Neither teachers nor students will be working this week or on Good Friday, April 10, which is a statewide holiday.
The statewide SBAC tests have been waived; consequently, IDCS students will not be taking this test.
I realize this is a very difficult and challenging time for everyone. The IDCS staff are working diligently to ensure that they are preparing and delivering student work as effectively and successfully as possible. Please contact your child's teacher if you have any questions about the school work. Please contact me if you have any general questions or concerns. We miss and love our students and our IDCS community!! Be well and be safe.
Sincerely,
Ellen Retelle

Good Morning I D C S families,

Students can access all IDCS online material with parents or caregivers personal devices at home via the IDCS website. Devices include personal computers, apple computers, tablets, iPads, etc. Please only request a chromebook if you do not have a device that your child can use to access the IDCS website.

post_text:
We still have openings in the Summer Intramural Basketball Program!
Stay active this summer and join our Intramural Basketball program for Boys and Girls grades 4-8 . This program will consist of 10 weeks, 3 days a week (Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays) from June 4th through August 8th from 4:00 p.m. - 6:00 p.m. The Program will be closed on July 4th. Students will have the opportunity to participate in skills, drills and games.The fee for this program will be $100 per student.
If you would like to drop in on some days you can pay $10 per day. (Drop in days need to be confirmed with Athletic Coordinator by email 24 hours in advance). Please contact Mrs.Monique to sign up or if you have any questions at moniquek@idcs.org.
Checks should be made payable to IDCS.
text:
We still have openings in the Summer Intramural Basketball Program!
Stay active this summer and join our Intramural Basketball program for Boys and Girls grades 4-8 . This program will consist of 10 weeks, 3 days a week (Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays) from June 4th through August 8th from 4:00 p.m. - 6:00 p.m. The Program will be closed on July 4th. Students will have the opportunity to participate in skills, drills and games.The fee for this program will be $100 per student.
If you would like to drop in on some days you can pay $10 per day. (Drop in days need to be confirmed with Athletic Coordinator by email 24 hours in advance). Please contact Mrs.Monique to sign up or if you have any questions at moniquek@idcs.org.
Checks should be made payable to IDCS.

post_text: The IDCS Summer Camp program still has openings! The camp is designed for students entering Pre-K through 4th grade and runs for 6 weeks from June 17th through July 26th from 8:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. for $120/week or $30/day. There is also an option for a fee based early start or late pick up. The kids will spend their days working on summer academics, playing outside on the playground, watching movies, making crafts, playing games, water activities, bounce house, using ipads, and dressing up on Fridays! Contact Monique Kercado at moniquek@idcs.org if you are interested in signing up. New, incoming IDCS students are also welcome to attend camp.
text: The IDCS Summer Camp program still has openings! The camp is designed for students entering Pre-K through 4th grade and runs for 6 weeks from June 17th through July 26th from 8:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. for $120/week or $30/day. There is also an option for a fee based early start or late pick up. The kids will spend their days working on summer academics, playing outside on the playground, watching movies, making crafts, playing games, water activities, bounce house, using ipads, and dressing up on Fridays! Contact Monique Kercado at moniquek@idcs.org if you are interested in signing up. New, incoming IDCS students are also welcome to attend camp.

Timothy Strong
October 20, 2015 at 6:10 PM ·

The IDCS girls are the 2015 league championship they worked so hard for this! Young group who didn't win a meet last year and with no 8th graders this team will all be returning next season! The boys were underdogs and finished in the top 3 they gave it everything had and really bonded together it's been a great season and it's not over yet we're going to states! Go eagles

The Annual IDCS Basket Raffle will be postponed until Thursday, April 2nd due to impending inclement weather for Friday, March 20th.

We hope to see you at this exciting event on April 2nd!
